title: Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Clock", September 12, 1934
medium: Graphite and green color pencil on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/501 MADISON AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite above stamp, lower right: SUPERCEDES OLD # 12, FORMER # 10 [arrow towards stamp]; inscribed in graphite in stamp: 520-12/FULL SIZE/RAND, E.W./ 9/12/34, 9/13, 3; inscribed in graphite, lower left: NOTE:/ BOTH HANDS BLUE NEON/8 m/m TUBING; dimensions, instructions, and materials in graphite.
description: Designs for large wall clock; detail of hands. Square face of clock, measuring nearly six feet on each side. Both hands of clock are blue neon against a square, mirrored face. No numbers on clock; twelve circular punties around clock face. Hands fastened to circular center piece of black Bakelite.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Clock", September 12, 1934.
September 12, 1934. Graphite and green color pencil on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-523.
